Package eg.ui.filetree

Class FileTree

java.lang.Object
eg.ui.filetree.FileTree
public class FileTree
extends java.lang.Object
The display of a project's file system in a JTree.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    FileTree​(TreePanel treePnl, FileOpener opener)  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String currentRoot()
    Gets this currently shown root which may be a subdirectory of the initial project root
    void setDeletableDir​(java.lang.String deletableDirName)
    Sets the directory that may be deleted (by using this popup menu) although it is not empty.
    void setProjectTree​(java.lang.String projectRoot)
    Sets the project's root directory and displays the file system at this root if the same root is not aready set
    void updateTree()
    Updates the tree at the currently shown root

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • FileTree

      public FileTree​(TreePanel treePnl, FileOpener opener)
      Parameters:
      treePnl - the TreePanel
      opener - the FileOpener

  • Method Details

    • setProjectTree

      public void setProjectTree​(java.lang.String projectRoot)
      Sets the project's root directory and displays the file system at this root if the same root is not aready set
      Parameters:
      projectRoot - the project's root directory

    • setDeletableDir

      public void setDeletableDir​(java.lang.String deletableDirName)
      Sets the directory that may be deleted (by using this popup menu) although it is not empty. Usually, non-empty folders are protected against deletion.
      Parameters:
      deletableDirName - the name of the directory that is deletable. Null or the empty string to not set a deletable directory

    • updateTree

      public void updateTree()
      Updates the tree at the currently shown root

    • currentRoot

      public java.lang.String currentRoot()
      Gets this currently shown root which may be a subdirectory of the initial project root
      Returns:
      the root
